ExposureReasonCS CodeSystem

The reason that an exposure occurred.

name: ExposureReasonCS
title: ExposureReasonCS
description: The reason that an exposure occurred.

concept.display: The subject voluntarily subjects him or herself to the exposure, for example, smoking or using a drug recreationally.
concept.definition: The subject voluntarily subjects him or herself to the exposure, for example, smoking or using a drug recreationally.

concept.display: The subject voluntarily takes a non-prescription substance to address health issues or for prevention, e.g. herbal remedy for depression.
concept.definition: The subject voluntarily takes a non-prescription substance to address health issues or for prevention, e.g. herbal remedy for depression.

concept.display: Involuntary exposure in a domestic setting., e.g., exposure to second-hand smoke.
concept.definition: Involuntary exposure in a domestic setting., e.g., exposure to second-hand smoke.

concept.display: Involuntary exposure in a workplace setting.
concept.definition: Involuntary exposure in a workplace setting.

concept.display: Involuntary exposure as a result of an accident.
concept.definition: Involuntary exposure as a result of an accident.

concept.display: The subject is addicted to the substance.
concept.definition: The subject is addicted to the substance.
